alert.note: Alert for Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 4:04PM EDT until July 17 at 10:52AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine... Swift River At Roxbury affecting Oxford County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swift River at Roxbury. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 PM EDT Sunday was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this afternoon to 2.6 feet this evening. It will then rise above flood stage to 8.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall below flood stage again late tonight to 2.9 feet early Wednesday morning then rise again. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
